t: Proverbs 12
Contrast the Upright and the Wicked
Whoever*pn loves discipline loves knowledge, But*ln he who hates reproof is stupid.
A*ln good man will obtain favor from the Lord,*s But*ln He will condemn a man who devises evil.
A*ln man will not be established by wickedness, But*ln the root of the righteous will not be moved.
An*ln excellent wife is the crown of her husband, But*ln she who shames him*i is like rottenness in his bones.
The*ln thoughts of the righteous are just, But*iln the counsels of the wicked are deceitful.
The*ln words of the wicked lie in wait for blood, But*ln the mouth of the upright will deliver them.
The*ln wicked are overthrown and are no more, But*ln the house of the righteous will stand.
A*ln man will be praised according to his insight, But*ln one of perverse mind will be despised.
Better*ln is he who is lightly esteemed and has a servant Than*ln he who honors himself and lacks bread.
A*ln righteous man has regard for the life of his animal, But*ln even*i the compassion of the wicked is cruel.
He*ln who tills his land will have plenty of bread, But*ln he who pursues worthless things*i lacks sense.
The*ln wicked man desires the booty of evil men, But*ln the root of the righteous yields fruit.*i
An*ln evil man is ensnared by the transgression of his lips, But*ln the righteous will escape from trouble.
A*ln man will be satisfied with good by the fruit of his words, And*ln the deeds of a man’s hands will return to him.
The*ln way of a fool is right in his own eyes, But*ln a wise man is he who listens to counsel.
A*ln fool’s anger is known at once, But*ln a prudent man conceals dishonor.
He*ln who speaks truth tells what is right, But*ln a false witness, deceit.
There*ln is one who speaks rashly like the thrusts of a sword, But*ln the tongue of the wise brings healing.
Truthful*ln lips will be established forever, But*ln a lying tongue is only for a moment.
Deceit*ln is in the heart of those who devise evil, But*ln counselors of peace have joy.
No*ln harm befalls the righteous, But*ln the wicked are filled with trouble.
Lying*ln lips are an abomination to the Lord,*s But*ln those who deal faithfully are His delight.
A*ln prudent man conceals knowledge, But*ln the heart of fools proclaims folly.
The*ln hand of the diligent will rule, But*ln the slack hand*i will be put to forced labor.
Anxiety*ln in a man’s heart weighs it down, But*ln a good word makes it glad.
The*ln righteous is a guide to his neighbor, But*ln the way of the wicked leads them astray.
A*ln lazy man does not roast his prey, But*ln the precious possession of a man is*i diligence.
In*ln the way of righteousness is life, And*ln in its*i pathway there is no death.
